results.title: Streetwise
results.brief_description: In this series of episodes that advise on self-defence, it is shown how women cope in difficult situations, and experts also comment on how to deal with threatening situations. Episode 1 - Self Defence; Episode 2 - Pick pockets; Episode 3 - Burglars; Episode 4 - Sexual Harassment.

results.title: Street life in Tehran
results.brief_description: A compilation of three short Iranian films all shot in Tehran and each purveying through its images, streetscapes of life and human behaviour at chosen moments in time. Independent and individual as each of these three films are, they also provide a juxtaposition to one another and an engaging focus on human interaction and reaction. “Deadtime” - An amusing look at what people do when they are stuck in congested city traffic with the traffic lights jammed on red. Close-up images of patient drivers, restless children, bored passengers and the various activities which take place to fill in the ticking minutes that appear to be turning into never-ending hours. No dialogue but contains street sounds and background music. “The White station” - In total contrast with “Deadtime”, this film presents a stark and isolated situation caused through a severe snow storm where a few brave and lonely souls are waiting for the arrival of the Tehran public transport system to pick them up. Evocative filming with just the sound of the wind and snow, interspersed with the occasional bird-life, simplistic and intriguing. No dialogue. “Tehran: the 25th hour” - On 29 November 1998 the return match of Iran and Australia for the World Cup 1998 was televised in Tehran live from Melbourne. Iran qualified and the quiet urban streets of Tehran soon transformed into mad scenes of jubilation and celebration, people everywhere of all ages joining in cheering and dancing, lining the streets on foot and in their cars. Two days later see this same mad passionate crowd contained in the Azadi Grand Stadium to welcome home their heroes - united and jubilant these fans are one. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: Streams of our city
results.creator_credit: Filmpartnership and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: For the people and industry of Melbourne, the rivers and streams of the city are as important today as they were to the first settlers. However little thought was given to their character and natural purpose as draining systems. Neglect has inevitably led to deterioration. This film shows some of the problems and ways of overcoming them.

results.title: Stream
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Campbell, Crawley Films and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Examines through seasonal changes and by following the course of a flowing water system, the two basic types of stream environments - erosional and depositional habits.

results.title: Strawberries without cream
results.brief_description: Strawberry plants are subject to virus degeneration diseases which formerly restricted the industry in Victoria. Resistant strains are now bred in an isolated area and supplied to growers, all plantings being replaced every three years, and the problem is controlled. The film shows how the scheme operates.

results.title: Stratford on Avon
results.brief_description: Offers a colorful display of Tudor buildings and gardens. Ann Hathaway’s famous cottage, and Shakespeare’s birth-place, exemplify Tudor half-timbered architecture. Shows lively scenes such as the annual Mop Fair.

results.title: Strategy for survival [TEFC]
results.creator_credit: Grant Foster, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The survival of several rare bird species in New Zealand is now threatened, and steps need to be taken for their conservation. Narrated by Sir Robert Falls.

results.title: Strangers in Paradise
results.brief_description: Experience the wonder down under - Australia, one of the most exciting, unspoilt and undiscovered destinations left on earth. Tourism is now Australia’s second biggest industry. “Strangers in Paradise” follows a group of American and British tourists on 10 day tour of Australia .. to find out what the tourists think and if the brochures really deliver.
